ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] crawl site with character #
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello, The #fragment of a url is not sent to the server, so the fact that it s treated as a comment may not matter. The url with or without #fragment

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] crawl site with character #

Hello,

The #fragment of a url is not sent to the server, so the fact that it's 
treated as a comment may not matter. The url with or without #fragment 
traditionally would have the same content.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fragment_identifier
"When an agent <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User_agent> (such as a Web 
browser) requests <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP#Request_methods> a 
resource <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resource_%28Web%29> from a Web 
server, the agent sends the URI to the server, but does not send the 
fragment. Instead, the agent waits for the server to send the resource, 
and then the agent processes the resource according to the document type 
and fragment value."

However, these days many websites have javascript that serves different 
content depending on the #fragment. Google has a scheme for making these 
urls crawler-friendly.
https://code.google.com/intl/sv-SE/web/ajaxcrawling/docs/getting-started.html
You might try converting your urls according to this scheme. If the site 
follows google's spec then it may be crawlable.

(Enhanced support is planned for heritrix some time in the future, see 
https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-1761)

Noah

^

>

>
> and in the crawler-beans.cxml the character # means a begining of a comment
>
> so how can i add this type of urls to seeds value ?
>
> Thanks for you help
